intro: Chrysanthemum helichrysiflorum, commonly known as the golden chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long-lasting blooms.
